title: Which 1975 thriller about a killer shark was directed by Steven Spielberg?
options: Close Encounters of the Third Kind
explanation: Jaws is a 1975 American thriller film directed by Steven Spielberg about a great white shark terrorizing a beach town.

title: Which 1977 film introduced audiences to the character Darth Vader?
options: Close Encounters of the Third Kind
explanation: Darth Vader first appeared in the 1977 film Star Wars, later retitled Star Wars: Episode IV – A New Hope.

title: Which actor played Indiana Jones in the 1981 film Raiders of the Lost Ark?
explanation: Harrison Ford stars as the archaeologist-adventurer Indiana Jones in Raiders of the Lost Ark.

title: Which 1985 film features a time machine built from a DeLorean sports car?
explanation: Back to the Future (1985) features a time machine built from a modified DeLorean car.

title: Which animated movie was Pixar’s first feature-length film, released in 1995?
explanation: Toy Story (1995) was Pixar’s first full-length feature film and the first entirely computer-animated feature.

title: Which 1994 film stars Tom Hanks as a man who unwittingly witnesses and influences key moments in U.S. history?

title: In which 2001 fantasy film does the elf Legolas first appear on the big screen?

title: Which 2019 superhero film briefly became the highest-grossing movie of all time before Avatar reclaimed the record?

title: Which 2024 action film stars Jason Statham as a former beekeeper seeking revenge?

title: Which 2024 sci-fi film stars Adam Sandler as a lonely astronaut encountering a mysterious creature?

title: Which 2024 monster film introduces a new giant kaiju named Shimo?

title: Which 2024 horror mystery stars Nicolas Cage as a reclusive serial killer known as Longlegs?

title: American Factory (2019) documents what cultural clash?
options: American and Chinese labor practices at an Ohio auto-glass factory
Traditional manufacturing vs. automation in Texas
explanation: The film observes tensions between Chinese management and American workers after a factory’s reopening.

title: Which actor portrays John Wick in the action film series?
explanation: Keanu Reeves plays the titular assassin across the John Wick franchise.

title: Which actor won an Academy Award for 'La La Land'?
explanation: Emma Stone won Best actor for her performance in the film.

title: Which actor played Tony Stark/Iron Man in the Marvel Cinematic Universe?
explanation: Robert Downey Jr. originated and defined the character from 2008 to 2019.

title: Who played Katniss Everdeen in 'The Hunger Games'?
explanation: Jennifer Lawrence portrayed the protagonist in all four films.

title: Which late actor won a posthumous Oscar for playing the Joker in 'The Dark Knight'?
explanation: Heath Ledger's performance earned a posthumous Academy Award for Best Supporting Actor.

title: Which actor starred as Furiosa in 'Mad Max: Fury Road'?
explanation: Charlize Theron played Imperator Furiosa in the acclaimed action film.

title: Who portrays Captain America in most Marvel films?
explanation: Chris Evans played Steve Rogers from 2011 to 2019.

title: Which actor stars as Neo in 'The Matrix' trilogy?
explanation: Keanu Reeves is known for his iconic role as Neo.

title: Who played Hermione Granger in the 'Harry Potter' series?
explanation: Emma Watson portrayed Hermione across all eight films.

title: Which actor portrayed Freddie Mercury in 'Bohemian Rhapsody'?
explanation: Rami Malek won an Oscar for his performance as the Queen frontman.

title: Who stars as Black Widow in the Marvel films?
explanation: Scarlett Johansson played Natasha Romanoff for more than a decade.

title: Which actor voices Woody in the 'Toy Story' franchise?
explanation: Tom Hanks provides the voice of Woody in all major installments.

title: Which actor played Rey in the Star Wars sequel trilogy?
explanation: Daisy Ridley portrayed Rey from 2015 through 2019.

title: Who played Wolverine for nearly two decades?
explanation: Hugh Jackman played Logan across multiple X-Men films.

title: Which actor starred as the lead detective in 'Se7en'?
explanation: Brad Pitt plays Detective David Mills opposite Morgan Freeman.

title: Which actor played Clarice Starling in 'The Silence of the Lambs'?
explanation: Jodie Foster won an Oscar for her performance as Clarice Starling.

title: Which actor played Jack in 'Titanic'?
explanation: Leonardo DiCaprio starred opposite Kate Winslet in the 1997 epic.

title: Who portrayed Ellen Ripley in the 'Alien' series?
explanation: Sigourney Weaver originated the iconic sci-fi role.

title: Which actor starred as Forrest Gump?
explanation: Tom Hanks won an Oscar for his performance in the title role.

title: Which actor played Harley Quinn in 'Suicide Squad'?
explanation: Margot Robbie's portrayal became one of the film's standout elements.

title: Which actor once worked as a circus entertainer and later became known for roles such as Gandalf and Magneto?
explanation: Ian McKellen has spoken about performing in small touring shows and circuses before rising to stage prominence.

title: Which actor grew up in a Scientology household before becoming a major HBO drama star?
explanation: Elisabeth Moss was raised in Scientology and later gained fame for 'Mad Men' and 'The Handmaid’s Tale'.

title: Which actor originally studied to be a priest before transitioning into acting?
explanation: Liam Neeson considered priesthood in his youth before discovering acting.

title: Which actor is multilingual and holds a psychology degree from Harvard?
explanation: Natalie Portman graduated from Harvard in psychology while maintaining an acting career.

title: Which actor trained as a professional tap dancer before becoming an Oscar-winning performer?
explanation: Tom Holland trained in dance, particularly tap, before gaining fame as Spider-Man.

title: Which actor is also an ordained minister who has officiated several weddings?
explanation: Emma Thompson became ordained and has officiated multiple ceremonies.

title: Which actor survived a near-fatal horseback accident that influenced his later career choices?
explanation: Christopher Reeve’s 1995 accident led him to advocacy and directing.

title: Which actor began her career as a war correspondent before turning to acting?
explanation: Gal Gadot served as a combat instructor and briefly worked in modeling and journalism before acting.

title: Which actor was homeless in his early years in LA before landing major comedic roles?
explanation: Chris Pratt lived in a van in Hawaii before he broke into acting.

title: Which actor is a skilled classical pianist and nearly pursued music professionally?
explanation: Anya Taylor-Joy trained intensively in piano before focusing on acting.

title: Which actor holds a PhD in neuroscience and continued research while acting on a sitcom?
explanation: Mayim Bialik earned her doctorate in neuroscience before starring in 'The Big Bang Theory'.

title: Which actor is also a licensed helicopter pilot and frequently flies rescue missions?
explanation: Harrison Ford has assisted in real-life rescue operations with his helicopter.

title: Which actor spent her early childhood on a commune in Nicaragua?
explanation: Uma Thurman’s early years included time on a Nicaraguan commune with her family.

title: Which actor apprenticed as a cobbler before becoming a multiple-Oscar-winning performer?
explanation: Daniel Day-Lewis famously paused acting to train as a shoemaker in Italy.

title: Which actor originally planned to become a marine biologist before being discovered?
explanation: Jessica Alba has spoken about wanting to pursue marine biology before entering acting.

title: Which actor is fluent in six languages, including German and Swahili?
explanation: Viggo Mortensen speaks numerous languages due to his multicultural upbringing.

title: Which actor began her career as a professional boxer before acting?
explanation: Gina Carano transitioned from MMA competition to film roles.

title: Which actor earned a college degree in biomedical engineering before pursuing films?
explanation: Ken Jeong studied medicine and practiced as a physician before comedy and acting.

title: Which actor was discovered while working at a fast-food restaurant at age 16?
explanation: Eva Mendes was scouted while working a retail and food-service job.

title: Which actor is known for being a published poet and photographer in addition to acting?
explanation: Viggo Mortensen has published poetry, photography books, and artwork.

title: Which actor overcame legal blindness with corrective surgeries before beginning her career?
explanation: Demi Moore underwent several surgeries to correct severe vision issues.

title: Which actor worked as a roadie for a punk band before shifting to TV and film?
explanation: Norman Reedus held odd jobs including touring with punk bands before acting.

title: Which actor is the granddaughter of Hollywood legend Tippi Hedren?
explanation: Dakota Johnson is the daughter of Melanie Griffith and granddaughter of Tippi Hedren.

title: Which actor’s early career included performing as a magician before becoming a leading man?
explanation: Neil Patrick Harris is a skilled magician and performs regularly.

title: Which actor is a certified EMT and has volunteered on emergency calls?
explanation: Rachel McAdams trained and served as an EMT before rising to stardom.

title: Which actor was once a competitive figure skater before turning to film?
explanation: Sebastian Stan trained in figure skating during his childhood.

title: Which actor speaks Russian fluently due to emigrating from Ukraine at a young age?
explanation: Mila Kunis emigrated from Ukraine at age 7 and is fluent in Russian.

title: Which actor once served in the U.S. Marines before attending Juilliard?
explanation: Adam Driver served as a Marine before injuries led him toward acting and Juilliard.

title: Which actor is also a bestselling author with multiple published memoirs?
explanation: Tina Fey’s memoir 'Bossypants' became a bestseller, among other works.

title: Which actor once lived in a remote Buddhist monastery in Japan, inspiring his later roles?
explanation: Forest Whitaker lived and studied in a Buddhist monastery, influencing his worldview and performances.

title: Which actor survived wartime malnutrition in Nazi-occupied Netherlands before becoming an Oscar-winning Hollywood icon?
explanation: Audrey Hepburn spent part of WWII in Arnhem, Netherlands, where she suffered from depression and malnutrition under Nazi occupation.

title: Which actor became the youngest performer to have four Academy Award nominations by age 29?
explanation: Kate Winslet earned four Oscar nominations by the age of 29, including for Sense and Sensibility, Titanic, Iris, and Eternal Sunshine of the Spotless Mind.

title: Which actor became the first Black woman to win the Emmy for Outstanding Lead actor in a Drama Series?
explanation: Viola Davis made history with her Emmy win for How to Get Away with Murder, in addition to her Oscar-winning performance in Fences.

title: Which actor was born Archibald Alec Leach and ran away with a troupe of acrobatic comedians before becoming a Hollywood legend?
explanation: Cary Grant, born Archibald Alec Leach, joined Bob Pender's troupe as a teenager, learning acrobatics and pantomime before turning to film.

title: Which actor first became famous as 'Easy Reader' on a children’s TV show before winning an Oscar for a driving-themed film?
explanation: Morgan Freeman played 'Easy Reader' on The Electric Company and later earned acclaim for Driving Miss Daisy, among many other roles.

title: Which actor won two Oscars for playing Southern women in crisis: one in the American Civil War and one in New Orleans?
explanation: Vivien Leigh won Best actor for Scarlett O’Hara in Gone with the Wind and for Blanche DuBois in A Streetcar Named Desire.

title: Which actor’s second wife was Vivien Leigh, with whom he performed Shakespeare and co-starred in films like That Hamilton Woman?
explanation: Laurence Olivier and Vivien Leigh were married for about two decades and appeared together on stage and in several films.

title: Which actor, famed for his cool persona, was also a dedicated race car driver and died from mesothelioma at age 50?
explanation: Steve McQueen, star of The Great Escape and Bullitt, had a passion for motor racing and died relatively young from mesothelioma.

title: Which actor helped popularize androgynous fashion with vests, ties, and loose trousers after a 1977 romantic comedy?
explanation: Diane Keaton’s wardrobe in Annie Hall sparked a major trend in androgynous, menswear-inspired fashion.

title: Which actor was the first to win back-to-back Oscars for Best Actor, including one for playing a Catholic priest to delinquent boys?
explanation: Spencer Tracy won consecutive Oscars for Captains Courageous and Boys Town, becoming the first actor to do so.

title: Which actor, known as the 'Baadshah of Bollywood', first gained fame on Indian television before breaking out in the film Deewana?
explanation: Shah Rukh Khan started in Indian TV serials, then achieved film stardom with Deewana and went on to be dubbed the 'Baadshah of Bollywood'.

title: Which actor, daughter of two actors, became a global star with Pretty Woman and later engaged in extensive UNICEF work?
explanation: Julia Roberts, born to actor parents in Georgia, broke through with Pretty Woman and later became known for her humanitarian work with UNICEF.

title: Which actor, a former child star, studied at Yale and won Oscars for The Accused and The Silence of the Lambs?
explanation: Jodie Foster started acting as a child, graduated magna cum laude from Yale, and won two Best actor Oscars by her early thirties.

title: Which performer, launched as a vaudeville child star, later became famous for singing 'Over the Rainbow'?
explanation: Judy Garland, born Frances Gumm, began in vaudeville and achieved immortal status as Dorothy in The Wizard of Oz, singing 'Over the Rainbow.'

title: Which actor, associated with roles as the principled 'common man', starred in both The Grapes of Wrath and 12 Angry Men?
explanation: Henry Fonda became emblematic of the decent, moral everyman in The Grapes of Wrath, 12 Angry Men, and many other films.

title: Which French actor became an international arthouse icon with Belle de Jour and The Umbrellas of Cherbourg?
explanation: Catherine Deneuve’s performances in The Umbrellas of Cherbourg and Belle de Jour cemented her status as a grande dame of French cinema.

title: Which actor left Hollywood at the height of her fame to become Princess of Monaco?
explanation: Grace Kelly retired from acting after films like Rear Window and To Catch a Thief to marry Prince Rainier III and become Princess of Monaco.

title: Which actor, born to a Russian father and English mother, won an Oscar for playing Queen Elizabeth II?
explanation: Helen Mirren, with Russian and English heritage, won the Best actor Oscar for her portrayal of Queen Elizabeth II in The Queen.

title: Which Welsh-born actor, invited to the National Theatre by Laurence Olivier, won an Oscar for playing Hannibal Lecter?
explanation: Anthony Hopkins, from Wales, was brought into the National Theatre by Olivier and later won the Oscar for The Silence of the Lambs.

title: Which actor, famous for tough gangsters, was also an accomplished dancer and starred in Angels with Dirty Faces?
explanation: James Cagney, known for his energetic style, combined gangster roles with remarkable dancing ability, as seen in films like Yankee Doodle Dandy.

title: In which film does Audrey Hepburn play the quirky socialite Holly Golightly, often seen with a pastry outside a jewelry store?
explanation: Audrey Hepburn plays Holly Golightly in Breakfast at Tiffany's, one of her most iconic roles.

title: Kate Winslet received her first Academy Award nomination for which period drama based on a Jane Austen novel?
explanation: Kate Winslet earned her first Oscar nomination for her role as Marianne Dashwood in Sense and Sensibility.

title: Viola Davis won the Academy Award for Best Supporting actor for which adaptation of an August Wilson play?
explanation: Viola Davis won an Oscar for reprising her stage role as Rose Maxson in the film Fences.

title: In which Alfred Hitchcock thriller does Cary Grant’s character get mistaken for a government agent and chased across Mount Rushmore?
explanation: Cary Grant plays advertising man Roger Thornhill in North by Northwest, famously pursued across Mount Rushmore.

title: Morgan Freeman plays a wise inmate named Red in which prison drama adapted from a Stephen King novella?
explanation: Morgan Freeman portrays Ellis 'Red' Redding in The Shawshank Redemption.

title: Vivien Leigh won her first Oscar for portraying which Southern belle caught up in the American Civil War?
options: Scarlett O’Hara in Gone with the Wind
Blanche DuBois in A Streetcar Named Desire
Melanie Wilkes in Gone with the Wind
explanation: Vivien Leigh’s first Oscar came from her role as Scarlett O’Hara in Gone with the Wind.

title: Laurence Olivier directed and starred in which Technicolor Shakespeare adaptation set during the Hundred Years’ War?
explanation: Laurence Olivier both directed and played the title role in his influential adaptation of Henry V.

title: Steve McQueen is seen driving a Ford Mustang in one of cinema’s most famous car chases in which film?
explanation: Steve McQueen’s legendary Mustang chase is in the crime thriller Bullitt.

title: Diane Keaton won the Academy Award for Best actor for her performance in which Woody Allen film?
explanation: Diane Keaton’s Oscar-winning turn is as Annie in Annie Hall.

title: Spencer Tracy plays a jurist presiding over post–World War II war-crimes trials in which courtroom drama?
explanation: Spencer Tracy stars as Chief Judge Dan Haywood in Judgment at Nuremberg.

title: Shah Rukh Khan plays Raj, who romances Simran on a European trip, in which landmark Bollywood romance?
explanation: Shah Rukh Khan’s Raj in Dilwale Dulhania Le Jayenge became an iconic romantic hero in Hindi cinema.

title: Julia Roberts won her first Academy Award for playing a legal clerk uncovering a water contamination scandal in which film?
explanation: Julia Roberts won Best actor for her title role in Erin Brockovich.

title: Jodie Foster plays FBI trainee Clarice Starling hunting a serial killer with the help of Hannibal Lecter in which thriller?
explanation: Jodie Foster’s Oscar-winning performance as Clarice Starling is in The Silence of the Lambs.

title: In which musical fantasy does Judy Garland’s character travel the Yellow Brick Road to meet a mysterious wizard?
explanation: Judy Garland plays Dorothy Gale in The Wizard of Oz, journeying along the Yellow Brick Road.

title: Henry Fonda plays jury member No. 8, who doubts a young man’s guilt, in which classic single-room courtroom drama?
explanation: Henry Fonda stars as the lone initial dissenter in 12 Angry Men.

title: Catherine Deneuve plays a respectable housewife who secretly works as a high-end prostitute in the afternoons in which Luis Buñuel film?
explanation: Catherine Deneuve portrays Séverine in Buñuel’s Belle de Jour.

title: Grace Kelly plays socialite Lisa Fremont, who suspects a neighbor of murder while peering out of a photographer’s window, in which film?
explanation: Grace Kelly co-stars with James Stewart in Alfred Hitchcock’s Rear Window.

title: Helen Mirren portrays Queen Elizabeth II dealing with the aftermath of Princess Diana’s death in which film?
explanation: Helen Mirren’s Oscar-winning performance as Elizabeth II is in The Queen.

title: Anthony Hopkins plays a loyal but emotionally repressed butler opposite Emma Thompson in which Merchant Ivory drama?
explanation: Anthony Hopkins plays butler Stevens in The Remains of the Day.

title: James Cagney famously shouts “Top of the world, Ma!” before an explosive finale in which gangster film?
explanation: James Cagney delivers the iconic line in the climax of White Heat.

title: In which romantic comedy does Audrey Hepburn’s chauffeur’s daughter character transform and capture the attention of two wealthy brothers?
explanation: Audrey Hepburn plays Sabrina Fairchild in Sabrina, opposite Humphrey Bogart and William Holden.

title: Kate Winslet’s character Rose survives a doomed ocean liner voyage and clings to a piece of wreckage in which film?
explanation: Kate Winslet co-stars with Leonardo DiCaprio in James Cameron’s Titanic.

title: Morgan Freeman narrates humanity’s struggle against an alien invasion in which Steven Spielberg adaptation of an H.G. Wells novel?
explanation: Morgan Freeman provides the narration for Spielberg’s War of the Worlds.

title: Steve McQueen leads prisoners in a daring mass breakout from a German POW camp in which World War II adventure film?
explanation: Steve McQueen plays Hilts, the 'Cooler King', in The Great Escape.

title: Diane Keaton plays Kay Adams, who gradually realizes the true nature of Michael Corleone’s business, in which crime saga?
explanation: Diane Keaton portrays Kay Adams-Corleone in The Godfather series.

title: Julia Roberts plays a bookstore customer who falls in love with a shy bookseller played by Hugh Grant in which London-set romance?
explanation: Julia Roberts plays movie star Anna Scott in Notting Hill.

title: Jodie Foster plays a radio astronomer who receives a signal from space in which science fiction drama based on a Carl Sagan novel?
explanation: Jodie Foster stars as Dr. Ellie Arroway in Contact.

title: Henry Fonda plays the outlaw-turned-legendary gunfighter opposite Claudia Cardinale and Charles Bronson in which Sergio Leone Western?
options: Once Upon a Time in the West
The Good, the Bad and the Ugly
explanation: Henry Fonda subverts his heroic image as villain Frank in Once Upon a Time in the West.

title: Catherine Deneuve plays an elegant plantation owner in French Indochina who raises a Vietnamese princess as her adopted daughter in which epic?
explanation: Catherine Deneuve stars as Éliane Devries in the historical drama Indochine.

title: Anthony Hopkins reprises his role as Hannibal Lecter opposite Julianne Moore’s Clarice Starling in which sequel to The Silence of the Lambs?
explanation: Anthony Hopkins returns as Lecter in Hannibal, set years after The Silence of the Lambs.

title: Roma (2018) follows Cleo working for a family in which city during the 1970s?
explanation: Cuarón’s Roma is set in the Colonia Roma neighborhood of Mexico City.

title: Amazing Grace (2018) documents Aretha Franklin recording a live gospel album in which location?
options: New Bethel Baptist Church, Los Angeles
explanation: Aretha recorded her landmark album at New Bethel Baptist Church in Watts.

title: Shoplifters (2018) centers on a poor Tokyo family who take in a neglected girl after finding her where?
explanation: Osamu and his son discover the shivering girl alone outside.

title: Shoah: Four Sisters (2018) consists of testimonies originally filmed for which earlier landmark documentary?
explanation: Claude Lanzmann revisited unused survivor interviews from Shoah.

title: Burning (2018) follows Jongsu as he becomes obsessed with Ben, who claims what unusual hobby?
explanation: Ben’s disturbing and ambiguous ‘hobby’ drives the film’s tension.

title: Gavagai (2018) follows Carsten as he travels to which country to fulfill his late wife's translation work?
explanation: Carsten journeys through Norway’s landscapes tied to the poet Tarjei Vesaas.

title: A Bread Factory Part Two (2018) portrays the arts center rehearsing which classic Greek tragedy?
explanation: The play Hecuba mirrors the disruptions happening outside the theater.

title: In A Bread Factory Part One (2018), the community arts center faces competition from what?
options: A celebrity artist couple's new complex
explanation: The arrival of high-profile performance artists threatens the center’s funding.

title: They Shall Not Grow Old (2018) uses restored archival footage from which war?
explanation: Peter Jackson colorized and enhanced WWI footage to bring soldiers’ lives to the present.

title: The Favourite (2018) focuses on political and personal intrigue during the reign of which British monarch?
explanation: Olivia Colman’s performance as Queen Anne earned international acclaim.

title: Cold War (2018) portrays the turbulent romance between Zula and Wiktor beginning in which country?
explanation: Their love story begins in post-war Poland amid a state-sponsored music ensemble.

title: The Tale (2018) follows Jennifer Fox re-examining what pivotal event from her youth?
explanation: Finding an old school story forces Jennifer to confront long-buried trauma.

title: Minding the Gap (2018) uses over a decade of footage primarily focused on which activity?
explanation: Bing Liu’s documentary explores masculinity and hardship through skateboard culture.

title: Zama (2018) follows a colonial officer desperately awaiting a transfer order from whom?
explanation: Zama’s fate hinges on a letter from the King that never arrives.

title: Dead Souls (2018) interviews survivors of reeducation camps in which country?
explanation: The film documents those labeled 'rightists' during China’s Anti-Rightist campaign.

title: Crime + Punishment (2018) follows whistleblower officers fighting against illegal quotas in which U.S. city?
explanation: NYPD officers expose pressure to meet arrest and summons targets.

title: Paddington 2 (2018) centers on Paddington trying to purchase what for Aunt Lucy?
explanation: The pop-up book becomes the film’s central object of affection and conflict.

title: The Death of Stalin (2018) dramatizes the frantic power struggle following Stalin’s death in which year?
explanation: The film satirizes the political chaos that erupted immediately after Stalin died.

title: A Star Is Born (2018) features Jackson Maine discovering Ally while she performs what?
explanation: He first hears her singing 'La Vie en Rose' at a drag club’s open mic night.

title: Sweet Country (2018) follows Sam after he kills a settler in which region of Australia?
explanation: Set in the harsh landscapes of the Northern Territory, Sam flees across the outback.

title: Leave No Trace (2018) begins with Will and Tom living secretly in which U.S. state?
explanation: They live hidden in Forest Park outside Portland, Oregon.

title: Shirkers (2018) explores the disappearance of which cinematic project?
explanation: Sandi Tan’s mentor stole the footage for her indie film Shirkers for 20 years.

title: Black Panther (2018) follows T’Challa returning to rule which technologically advanced African nation?
explanation: Wakanda blends tradition with futuristic innovation behind its hidden borders.

title: Jane Fonda in Five Acts (2018) divides Fonda’s life into chapters framed around what?
options: The major men who shaped different eras of her life
explanation: The film uses five influential male figures to structure Fonda’s evolution.

title: Amazing Grace (2018) features Aretha Franklin accompanied by which choir?
explanation: Led by Alexander Hamilton, the choir supports Franklin’s historic performance.

title: Roma (2018) depicts Cleo’s employers as belonging to which social class?
explanation: The family Cuarón depicts lives in middle-class Colonia Roma.

title: The Favourite (2018) shows Abigail rising in status through gaining whose favor?
explanation: Abigail becomes Queen Anne’s new confidante, threatening Sarah’s influence.

title: Cold War (2018) repeatedly reunites Wiktor and Zula in which romantic city?
explanation: Paris becomes a recurring site of longing and disillusionment.

title: Paddington 2 (2018) features Paddington wrongfully imprisoned because of what crime?
explanation: The real thief frames Paddington for stealing the antique pop-up book.

title: A Star Is Born (2018) depicts Ally’s rapid rise to fame contrasted with Jack’s struggle with what?
explanation: Jack’s alcoholism and personal demons form the tragic backbone of the film.

title: In Dunkirk (2017), which aspect of the film most benefits from Nolan’s decision to minimize dialogue?
explanation: The lack of dialogue heightens the raw physical urgency of the evacuation.

title: Faces Places (2017) showcases JR’s art style. What detail about his portraits most contributes to their emotional impact?
explanation: The enormous prints turn everyday individuals into monumental figures.

title: Call Me by Your Name (2017) ends with a long unbroken shot of Elio by the fireplace. Which aspect of filmmaking is emphasized here?
explanation: The lingering close-up foregrounds the rawness of Timothée Chalamet’s performance.

title: Lady Bird (2017) places emphasis on Sacramento’s geography for what narrative effect?
explanation: The suburban sprawl symbolizes Lady Bird’s desire to escape.

title: Which recurring motif in The Florida Project (2017) reflects childhood resilience amid instability?
explanation: Fireworks become a symbol of wonder despite the family's hardships.

title: EX LIBRIS (2017) presents NYPL events featuring which unexpected source of civic debate?
explanation: Talks on science and space connect the library to a broad intellectual community.

title: I Called Him Morgan (2017) gains narrative momentum from which type of archival material?
explanation: Radio segments and interviews provide context for Morgan’s life and legacy.

title: Phantom Thread (2017) illustrates Reynolds’ perfectionism partly through his morning rituals, which include what?
explanation: His strict morning routines hint at the rigidity of his personality.

title: Uncertain (2017) portrays a community affected by an ecological threat to their lake caused by what?
explanation: Drought impacts the region's ecosystem and the residents' livelihoods.

title: Columbus (2017) uses its architecture-laden setting to highlight which emotional state shared by its leads?
explanation: They bond over appreciating design even while they struggle personally.

title: In Transit (2017) includes candid conversations among strangers. What gives these interactions their unique weight?
explanation: Meeting through chance seating amplifies the film’s sense of impermanence.

title: Three Billboards Outside Ebbing, Missouri (2017) is thematically anchored by what narrative principle?
explanation: Characters struggle over justice that never resolves cleanly.

title: Quest (2017) was filmed over nearly a decade. What long-term change most shapes the family's story?
explanation: The neighborhood’s shifting landscape mirrors the family's challenges.

title: Foxtrot (2017) features a major plot twist centered on which narrative element?
explanation: The mistaken report of a soldier’s death drives the story’s emotional turns.

title: Restless Creature: Wendy Whelan (2017) focuses on which significant transition in Whelan’s career?
explanation: Her collaborations challenge traditional ballet structures.

title: The Farthest (2017) highlights Voyager’s famous message to the cosmos. What is the central component of that message?
explanation: Mathematical patterning helps extraterrestrials decode the record.

title: Jane (2017) incorporates rediscovered 1960s footage using what cinematic texture?
explanation: The restored archival film retains its monochrome tonality and texture.

title: My Journey Through French Cinema (2017) devotes significant time to which foundational influence on Tavernier?
explanation: He was deeply influenced by grounded realism in mid-century French films.

title: The Shape of Water (2017) blends genres. Which cinematic tradition most heavily shapes its production design?
explanation: The angular shadows and stylized sets echo expressionist influences.

title: Dawson City: Frozen Time (2017) uses nitrate film decomposition as part of its imagery. What unique effect does this create?
explanation: The aging footage warps visually over time, symbolizing cinema’s fragility.

title: The Red Turtle (2017) is notable for which trademark of its animation style?
explanation: The film conveys emotion without spoken words.

title: Chasing Coral (2017) accomplishes its underwater documentation using which innovation?
explanation: Specialized rigs were engineered to withstand long underwater placements.

title: My Happy Family (2017) explores which major cultural tension highlighted by Manana’s decision?
explanation: Her move reflects broader social changes in Georgian urban life.

title: Loveless (2017) uses cold, desaturated cinematography to emphasize what thematic concern?
explanation: The visual palette mirrors the emotional deterioration of the characters.

title: Dunkirk (2017) employs Shepard tones in its soundtrack. What does this auditory illusion create?
options: A sense of endless rising tension
explanation: Zimmer manipulates tone cycles to simulate perpetual ascent.

title: Faces Places (2017) includes a visit to which type of rural workplace, where workers pose for large-scale portraits?
explanation: Workers at a dairy become subjects of one of the film’s most striking murals.

title: In Call Me by Your Name (2017), the Perlmans’ villa reflects which recurring cinematic theme?
explanation: Books, manuscripts, and artifacts signal an intellectual household.

title: The Florida Project (2017) features a standout performance by Willem Dafoe. What trait defines his character Bobby?
explanation: Though understated, his character balances firmness with empathy.

title: Three Billboards (2017) derives much of its tension from what structural choice?
options: A series of confrontations without clear resolutions
explanation: Conflicts escalate without offering neat answers.

title: Jane (2017) gains emotional power from pairing archival film with whose contemporary score?
explanation: Glass’s music shapes the film’s meditative tone.

title: Which actor earned an Oscar nomination for portraying Tina Turner in 1993?
explanation: Angela Bassett received an Academy Award nomination for her performance in 'What’s Love Got to Do with It.'

title: Which actor made his film debut in 'A Nightmare on Elm Street' (1984)?
explanation: Johnny Depp appeared on screen for the first time in Wes Craven’s horror film.

title: Which actor retired after 'Two-Faced Woman' (1941) and lived a reclusive life in New York?
explanation: Greta Garbo withdrew from acting and maintained strict privacy afterward.

title: Which actor sued Warner Bros. in a landmark case later known as the De Havilland Decision?
explanation: Olivia de Havilland’s legal victory reshaped Hollywood contract law.

title: Which actor played Eliza Doolittle in the original Broadway run of 'My Fair Lady'?
explanation: Julie Andrews originated the role on Broadway in 1956.

title: Which actor co-starred with Bette Davis in 'What Ever Happened to Baby Jane?'
explanation: Joan Crawford appeared opposite Davis in the psychological thriller.

title: Which actor was known as the 'Eternal Virgin' in Japanese cinema?
explanation: Setsuko Hara earned the nickname due to her signature roles.

title: Which actor famously collaborated with director Federico Fellini multiple times?
explanation: Mastroianni starred in major Fellini films including '8½' and 'La Dolce Vita.'

title: Which actor starred as Maria in the 1961 film 'West Side Story'?
explanation: Natalie Wood played Maria in the classic musical adaptation.

title: Which actor became a major star after appearing in 'Rebel Without a Cause'?
explanation: James Dean’s performance solidified his iconic cultural status.

title: Which actor created the character of the Little Tramp in silent cinema?
explanation: Charles Chaplin’s Little Tramp is one of the most recognizable characters in film history.

title: Which actor became known for intense roles in films like 'The Piano Teacher'?
